Ostermueller, Erik wrote:
> Mike Clark wrote:
> 
> 
>>That being said, when I'm trying to add new 
>>functionality to legacy code 
>>that doesn't have tests, I'll gain confidence in any 
>>way possible.  If I 
>>can easily run a tool that generates some amount of 
>>tests, then I'll use 
>>those tests as another anchor point.  That is, I'll sic 
>>the tool on the 
>>existing code base, then continually run the tests it 
>>generates as I'm 
>>retrofitting the code.  Better than nothin'.
> 
> 
> Another thing you might get is a false sense of security.
> 


Perhaps, though I don't see how it could be any less secure than mucking 
with code without the benefit of tests.  I agree that the tests should 
be taken with a grain of salt.  Again, better than nothin'.

Mike
